Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with handle attachment; underside partially glazed black; edges of handle plate glazed black; on top, black line on left and brown line on right, framing black-figure decoration consisting of head to left of long-haired, bearded man (possibly trace of fillet in added red).
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of Louvre F6
Curator's comments: In his journal for 1884-5, p.32, Petrie mentions acquiring two handle-plates like this. This may not therefore be from excavation.

For handle plates of column kraters attributed to the Painter of Louvre F6, see Oxford 1892.34 (190) in ABV, 124, no. 16; two sherds from Naukratis: Oxford AN1896-1908-G.577 and Oxford AN1896-1908-G.125; see also Athens, Agora, P 14564 in Agora XXIII, pl. 44 no. 448.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.21)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 276, no. B229)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0150) (Phase 1)
